channel.title: Microsoft Vs. Apple (MP3 Players)
channel.description:
:eek:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/5205296.stm
Would you still buy iPods, or would you get an MS Player?
When it comes out, and the price drops, I'm gonna buy an MS one. MS wont bring out an MP3 player unless it has something that could challenge the iPod. I think you'll be able to download music wirelessly. With microsoft points, which you can use from your XBl gamertag, which is already being ported to vista.
What're your thoughts?
EDIT:
some more news:
[img]http://files.xboxic.com/general/microsoft-argo/microsoftargoplayer.jpg[/img] ^^^SEXPLZ^^^^
This, will have Wifi, Wireless downloads, and you can have your gamertag from XBL onto it. So your gamertag will be available on 4 platforms: Xbox, PC (running Vista), Mobile Phone, and Zune. I reckon you'll be able to transfer your music from your PC (Vista) to your Zune wirelessly, and then hook it to your 360. Also, you'll probablky be able to play XBL arcade on the Zune.

item.title: Microsoft Vs. Apple (MP3 Players)
item.dc:creator: @trinsic trinsic
item.description:
@trinsic wrote:

iPods are in the music market so no its not meant for playing high end games. I have played doom on my ipod through linux which while fun it dies quickly ;D

Also this new MS player is made by the same team who made the xBox and 360 so don’t expect it to be anything like Windows. Another note: if you can’t crash your pc then there is something wrong with you. (Windows 98 release, Gates gets a BSOD)

item.title: Microsoft Vs. Apple (MP3 Players)
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

no, i was planning to do that today. Typing on my psp takes way too long lol.
And i’m not gonna apologize, because windows does suck. (Okay, i love Vista, but nt-xp suck). Never had a crash? You are proberly only reading your mails etc. But like me, with about 10 programs running, it does crash very often. For example:
I’m making a new website and i start Firefox. When i’m at low ram, windows is gonna write on the HD. And then: crash! Firefox has encountered errors blablabla. BOOM, all programs closed and bye bye website :eek:
And ehh, did you knew mac has 0 virusses
Maybe they’re not gonna put windows on their mp3 player, then it will proberly rock. But with windows, it’s as stable as mopar’s server

Read full topic

the thing i like and dislike about the newer macs coming out the acual computer looks fancy with clear plastic and stuff everywhere and the mose looks pimp but, it kind of looks fragile unlike a pc whitch is like a rock.[/quote]

item.title: Microsoft Vs. Apple (MP3 Players)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

S!ms:

who does trust anything with running WINDOWS on it?? I bet they’re gonna crash even more often than the iPod’s…HELLO?! it is made by microsoft!!!

Whats wrong with microsoft? What did it do to you?

  1. It never crashes, unless your computer sucks

  2. It’s less expensive than mac ( macintosh pc’s are about $1000 - $3000 + the software, like $600 ( I think))

  3. You can actually afford to buy other things other than pc stuff…

Btw, PSP is THE one for movies, games, MP3 / WMV player (any media format), wireless internet and flash drive, only for about $249 now…

Read full topic

You also realise that mac OS’s Freeze more often than windows?

Kthxbye.

For me, it’s about what they do and how easy do they break, my little 256 MB mp3 player is small, never broken and good.

item.title: Microsoft Vs. Apple (MP3 Players)
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:2, topic:5998”]I hate iPods, Mine broke out of the blue. I didn’t drop it or anything. :\

I read the troubleshooting section and did everything it said, I resetted it, restore, ect… Still dosn’t work. So i’m pissed off that i’ve wasted $300.

Oh, and i sent it off to get fixed, they sent it back still broken.

Tossers they are.[/quote]
same thing happend to me exept i took it back to the store and they gave me a refund… then off i went to buy a psp… much better to spend my money on
